message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product for $100. This is a high-quality item that I believe would greatly benefit you. Let me know if this works for you or if you'd like to discuss further.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $80. I've done some research and I believe that's a fair price for this product. Can you meet me at $80?

I appreciate your interest in our product, Bob. While we aim to accommodate reasonable offers, I must respectfully decline the $80 proposal. Our current asking price remains at $100. We believe this reflects the value and quality of the product. If you're still interested, I'd be happy to discuss further.

I understand that you're committed to your price, but I'm still not convinced that $100 is the best value for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll offer $90 for the product. Can you consider this proposal?

Thank you for considering our product, Bob. After reviewing your offer, I'm pleased to extend a counteroffer of $95. I believe this strikes a balance between our original price and your proposed offer, while still reflecting the value and quality of the product. I hope this meets your expectations.
I appreciate your revised offer, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to go up to $92, but no higher. Can you meet me at $92?
